channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: #79 - Perl at FOSDEM
item.description: This week, lots of small things. Edited by Yanick.

item.title: pause.perl.org moved
item.description: PAUSE has a new home. Everything went smoothly, biggest change: FTP access to PAUSE has gone bye-bye (uploads are done via HTTP/HTTPS).

item.title: Perl@FOSDEM2012: we will be there
item.description: FOSDEM. It's in Brussels. It's February 2nd and 3rd and there will be a Perl dev-room. Thanks to the heroic work of Claudio and Wendy and probably a few others, in a last minute call, they managed to put together a full day of rather interesting Perl-related talks to fill the dev-room. For details, check the post of Claudio and the links from his writing.

item.title: Perl 5.17.8 is now available
item.description: ... and 5.18.0 is really not very far either. (at last news, it should be landing in May)

item.title: YAPC::NA 2013 in Texas, June 3-5.
item.description: Registrations and talk submissions are now open. Go.

item.title: the speed of Perl file finders
item.description: Want to find files on your system? Lots of files? Ricardo Signes offers a review of the hunter-killer modules out there, and how do they perform in function of the size of the haystack they have to wade through.

item.title: Improving Perl's New Programmer Outreach
item.description: So, there's that concept that Perl is kinda undead flying around. And, as gothic literature taught us, the Coded Undead (also known as Nosferaturings) need a constant input of young blood if they don't want to crumble into dusty irrelevance. In a somewhat related spirit, VM Brasseur discusses how we could, and should, improve our outreach to new programmers to keep our continued existence on the road to sparkliness.

item.title: Net::Statsd::Server, a Perl port of Flickr/Etsy's statsd
item.description: Cosimo Streppone shows us his Perl port of statsd, and how it can holds its ground against the original nodejs implementation.

item.title: Newsmill (aka an excuse to play with shinies)
item.description: By "guest-editing the Perl Weekly", Gabor meant "write a new database backend for it". And a web front-end. With HTML 5 shinies, and perhaps use a pet templating system while we are at it? ... Right?

item.title: Blio updates
item.description: Domm's blog engine, Blio, has been updated. Amongst the new features: automatic publishing via git hooks.

item.title: plenv - brand new perl5 installation management tool
item.description: A new install tool from tokuhirom, inspired by Ruby's rbenv.

item.title: Core Perl tickets requiring no C, perlguts, or OS expertise
item.description: You want to carve into your name into the very code of Perl, but fear your hack-fu is not strong enough? Balderdash! Here's a meta-ticket corralling a bunch of smaller tasks that don't require the mastery of eldritch technologies. Verily, only a wee bit of elbow grease stands before you and history, so hurry up!

item.title: Modules to be removed before 5.20.0
item.description: Forewarned is forearmed. Some core modules have received the black patch and shall disappear from the Perl core library before 5.20 is out. Do you know which ones?

item.title: Scraping the web (Web::Scraper) and CSS
item.description: Harvesting information off web pages. We all do it. Sometimes wholesale, sometimes cherry-picking information with regular expressions, sometimes being fancier with XPath. And how about using CSS selectors? Ulrich Habel shows us how.

item.title: Why Unicode Normalization Matters
item.description: chromatic reminds us why most grown men cry when Unicode enter the picture (which, nowadays, is pretty much constantly).

item.title: Profiling Dist::Zilla
item.description: Dist::Zilla is awesome, but a little bit on the slow side. Olivier Mengué asks us to help to optimize its plugins for speed, and provides a few tricks and tools to profile the beast.

item.title: Terminal Hero
item.description: The obvious Guitar Hero variation for hackers, courtesy of Macieja Ciemborowicza.

item.title: git-spark plots your commit history
item.description: Sometimes we come up with useful stuff. Sometimes, it's not that useful, but it still pretty darn cool. This command-line commit sparkline generator by Eric squarely falls under the latter category.

item.title: Parrot 5.0.0 "Johnny Five Alive" Released!
item.description: The rise of the machines is upon us. And it's adorable. A new major version of Parrot, codenamed for the lovable cousin of the T-800, is out. Amongst other things, it now comes with yummy thread support.

item.title: Israeli Perl-Workshop 2013 (ILPW)
item.description: February 25, 2013, Tel Aviv, Israel

item.title: German Perl-Workshop 2013
item.description: March 13-15, 2013, Berlin, Germany

item.title: Swiss Perl Workshop 2013
item.description: March 22, 2013, Bern, Switzerland
